definition: breath/news/interest (on an investment or loan)/to cease/to stop/to rest/Taiwan pr. [xi2]

sentences.english: He had the air of soldier standing at ease.
sentences.chinese: 他那神氣活象一位稍息着的士兵。

sentences.english: They were relieved at the news.
sentences.chinese: 聽了這稍息，他們放心了。

sentences.english: The commands Attention and Halt are only one word.
sentences.chinese: 立正和稍息的口令只有一個字。

sentences.english: Put the soldiers at ease while waiting for inspection.
sentences.chinese: 等待檢閱時讓士兵們稍息。

sentences.english: When we heard the order"at ease", we were all relaxed.
sentences.chinese: 當我們聽到“稍息”的口令時，我們都放鬆了。

sentences.english: The soldiers are standing at ease now.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們現在在立正稍息。

definition: to march at parade step/March! (military command)
to stop/to halt/halt!/to hold resolutely (of a view, an aspiration etc)
to drill/to exercise/to go outdoors for physical exercise
to stand respectfully/(of trees, mountains) standing tall and majestic
to dress (troops)/to line up (to arrange in a straight line)
to follow your orders/to do as you bid
